pullRequest.body:
* Added lemma `aemeasurable_pi_lambda` for `AEMeasurable (f : α → ∀ a : δ, X a) μ` for countable `δ`, parallel to `measurable_pi_lambda`.
* Showed that a finite collection of random variables are independent iff their joint law is the product distribution of their respective laws.

This lemma is needed in CLT.

I am using git blame on PFR to figure out the person (@MantasBaksys) who wrote this and adding to co-authored-by field:

Co-authored-by: Mantas Bakšys <baksys.mantas@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fb56946104](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23418/commits/fb569461042a6c94cf34ba4fed93853e263351c5)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic | 1540 | 1558 | +18 (+1.17%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Density` `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Uniform`|1|
|<details><summary>7 files</summary> `Mathlib.Probability.BorelCantelli` `Mathlib.Probability.CondVar` `Mathlib.Probability.ConditionalExpectation` `Mathlib.Probability.IdentDistrib` `Mathlib.Probability.Integration` `Mathlib.Probability.Moments.Basic` `Mathlib.Probability.Variance`</details>|9|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Integrable`|12|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Independence.Basic`|18|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ aemeasurable_pi_iff`
`+ aemeasurable_pi_lambda`
`+ iIndepFun_iff_map_fun_eq_pi_map`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

One style question I had but forgot to ask is: currently `iIndepFun_iff_pi_map_eq_map` and `indepFun_iff_map_prod_eq_prod_map_map` have different directions on the RHS of iff (`pi_eq_map` vs `map_eq_prod`). I think they (and their naming) should be unified, but I don't know which direction makes more sense.
The rewriting direction of `indepFun_iff_map_prod_eq_prod_map_map` seems the more natural to me: you use independence to say that the joint law is a product.

> The rewriting direction of `indepFun_iff_map_prod_eq_prod_map_map` seems the more natural to me: you use independence to say that the joint law is a product.

Thanks, I changed the direction of my newly added theorem. After changing the direction, I renamed to `iIndepFun_iff_map_fun_eq_pi_map` because in my opinion it makes more sense than `iIndepFun_iff_map_eq_pi_map`; but if you have any name suggestions I am very happy to change it
Thanks for upstreaming this!

The new code is mixing `=>` and `↦` for functions. Let's use only one.
```suggestion
    AEMeasurable g μ ↔ ∀ a, AEMeasurable (fun x ↦ g x a) μ := by
```

I find the use of forall a bit strange for a product type.
```suggestion
theorem aemeasurable_pi_iff {g : α → Π a, X a} :
```
Thanks, I definitely agree. I copied signature from `measurable_pi_iff`. Should I also change this notation there?

```suggestion
theorem aemeasurable_pi_lambda (f : α → Π a, X a) (hf : ∀ a, AEMeasurable (fun c ↦ f c a) μ) :
```

```suggestion
variable {δ : Type*} [Countable δ] {X : δ → Type*} {mX : ∀ a, MeasurableSpace (X a)}
```
To allow for sigma-algebras that are not the one found by typeclass inference.
Same as above, I copied this from `measurable_pi_iff` in `Mathlib/MeasureTheory/MeasurableSpace/Basic.lean`. Should I also change the notation in that file? (perhaps in separate PR)
Another PR modifying that other file would be welcome. Let's not do this in this PR though.
Can you move that next to `ProbabilityTheory.indepFun_iff_map_prod_eq_prod_map_map`?
`indepFun_iff_map_prod_eq_prod_map_map` also works for finite measures. Can you also relax the `IsProbabilityMeasure μ` assumption here to have `IsFiniteMeasure μ` instead?

I tried to do that but had limited success: I don't need any assumption for the forward direction because of `iIndepFun.isProbabilityMeasure`. But for the reverse direction there are special cases: if ι is singleton, then it seems the RHS of ↔ is unconditionally true, while LHS requires µ to be a probability measure.

```suggestion
    (hf : ∀ i, AEMeasurable (f i) μ) :
```
That variable is denoted by i everywhere in the proof.
That's a non-terminal `simp`. Please replace it by a `simp only`.
Nice catch, sorry I didn't notice that! Thank you!

pullRequest.title: feat(Probability/Independence/Basic): upstream `iIndepFun_iff_pi_map_eq_map` from PFR
